thread.title: High school roundup: Teddy Brushini scores four goals to lead South Glens Falls soccer to win
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Teddy Brushini scores four goals to lead South Glens Falls soccer to win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Teddy Brushini scores four goals to lead South Glens Falls soccer to win
text:
Teddy Brushini scored all four goals for South Glens Falls as the Bulldogs beat Glens Falls 4-0.
Brushini scored in the 11th minute to get things started after a nice combo and feed from Connor Mallory set him in alone on the Indians' goal. He would get two more in the first half and finished his fourth 20 minutes into the second. Glens Falls keeper Will Allen made 11 saves and the Bulldogs' Ben Wilson recorded his sixth shutout this season.
More boys' soccer: Maple Hill remains undefeated at 11-0 after the Wildcats topped Patroon Conference rival Catskill 6-0. Tyler Hall scored the night's first goal and junior Garrett Axtmann led the team with a hat trick. Catskill's goalkeeper Eric Piraino had 22 saves.
Girls' tennis: Chatham's Gaby Neven and Ana Verma won the doubles championship at the Patroon Conference Tournament, defeating Hudson's Fahmida Choudhury and Jennifer Rosete 6-1, 6-1. The singles championship between Kayley Fountain of Maple Hill and Alicia Decker of Coxsackie-Athens was postponed due to darkness. Fountain won the first set 6-3. The match will conclude Tuesday.
Girls' soccer: Voorheesville trounced Fonda 11-0 with trio Veda Hensel, Kaelyn Lawson and Julia Voss each netting a hat trick. Fonda's netminder Alexandra Krohn kept another 31 shots from crossing the goal line. ... Tamarac's Camille Gardner tallied four goals and two assists in the team's 10-1 rout over Granville. Sydney Moss contributed three goals and an assist in the win. Alexis Smith had the Horde's lone goal.
Boys' volleyball: Damien Whittemore racked up eight kills, 11 service points and four digs in Niskayuna's 3-0 win over Shaker. The game scores were 25-15, 25-21, 25-16. Manny Valenza contributed a big block in set three to help seal the victory.
